summary: In 2010, the Office of Management and Budget began an effort to reduce the number of duplicative or outdated federal data centers. Legislation and other OMB efforts have followed. Our progress review found: Agencies closed 58 data centers in FY 2021 Agencies expected to close 78 centers in FY 2022 22 of 24 agencies met their savings goals for FY 2021, identifying $612 million in...
title: Data Center Optimization: Agencies Continue to Report Progress
